front.title: Defining the Role and Function of IETF Protocol Parameter Registry Operators

abstract.t: Many IETF protocols make use of commonly defined values that are passed within protocols. To ensure consistent interpretation of these values by independent implementations, the values and associated semantic intent must be uniquely defined. The IETF uses registry functions to record assigned protocol parameter values and their associated semantic intent. For each IETF protocol parameter it is current practice for the IETF to delegate the role of protocol parameter registry operator to a nominated entity. This document provides a description of and the requirements for these delegated functions.
